member.name: T:ReflectionAbstractionExtensions
member.summary: This class represents utility methods needed to supplement the reflection capabilities provided by the CLR

member.name: M:ReflectionAbstractionExtensions.GetBindingFlags(Xunit.Abstractions.IMethodInfo)
member.summary: Gets the binding flags for finding this method via reflection.
member.param: The method to get binding flags for.

member.name: M:ReflectionAbstractionExtensions.GetBindingFlags(System.Reflection.MethodInfo)
member.summary: Gets the binding flags for finding this method via reflection.
member.param: The method to get binding flags for.

member.name: M:ReflectionAbstractionExtensions.GetCustomAttributes(Xunit.Abstractions.IAssemblyInfo,System.Type)
member.summary: Gets all the custom attributes for the given assembly.
member.param: The assembly
The type of the attribute
member.returns: The matching attributes that decorate the assembly

member.name: M:ReflectionAbstractionExtensions.GetCustomAttributes(Xunit.Abstractions.IAttributeInfo,System.Type)
member.summary: Gets all the custom attributes for the given attribute.
member.param: The attribute
The type of the attribute to find
member.returns: The matching attributes that decorate the attribute

member.name: M:ReflectionAbstractionExtensions.GetCustomAttributes(Xunit.Abstractions.IMethodInfo,System.Type)
member.summary: Gets all the custom attributes for the method that are of the given type.
member.param: The method
The type of the attribute
member.returns: The matching attributes that decorate the method

member.name: M:ReflectionAbstractionExtensions.GetCustomAttributes(Xunit.Abstractions.ITypeInfo,System.Type)
member.summary: Gets all the custom attributes for the given type.
member.param: The type
The type of the attribute
member.returns: The matching attributes that decorate the type

member.name: T:Xunit.Abstractions.ITestFramework
member.summary: Represents a test framework. There are two pieces to test frameworks: discovery and execution. The two factory methods represent these two pieces.

member.name: M:Xunit.Abstractions.ITestFramework.GetDiscoverer(Xunit.Abstractions.IAssemblyInfo)
member.summary: Get a test discoverer.
member.param: The assembly from which to discover the tests.

member.name: M:Xunit.Abstractions.ITestFramework.GetExecutor(System.String)
member.summary: Get a test executor.
member.param: The file path of the assembly to run tests from.

member.name: T:Xunit.Abstractions.ITestFrameworkDiscoverer
member.summary: Represents an implementation of the discovery part of a test framework.

member.name: M:Xunit.Abstractions.ITestFrameworkDiscoverer.Find(System.Boolean,Xunit.Abstractions.IMessageSink)
member.summary: Starts the process of finding all tests in an assembly.
member.param: Whether to include source file information, if possible.
The message sink to report results back to.

member.name: M:Xunit.Abstractions.ITestFrameworkDiscoverer.Find(System.String,System.Boolean,Xunit.Abstractions.IMessageSink)
member.summary: Starts the process of finding all tests in a class.
member.param: The fully qualified type name to find tests in.
Whether to include source file information, if possible.
The message sink to report results back to.

member.name: M:Xunit.Abstractions.ITestFrameworkDiscoverer.Serialize(Xunit.Abstractions.ITestCase)
member.summary: Serializes a test case into string form.
member.param: The test case to be serialized.
member.returns: The serialized representation of the test case.

member.name: T:Xunit.Abstractions.ITestFrameworkExecutor
member.summary: Represents an implementation of the execution part of a test framework.

member.name: M:Xunit.Abstractions.ITestFrameworkExecutor.Deserialize(System.String)
member.summary: Deserializes a test case.
member.param: The string representation of the test case.

member.name: M:Xunit.Abstractions.ITestFrameworkExecutor.Run(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Xunit.Abstractions.ITestCase},Xunit.Abstractions.IMessageSink)
member.summary: Starts the process of running tests.
member.param: The test methods to run; if null, all tests in the assembly are run.
The message sink to report results back to.

member.name: T:Xunit.Abstractions.IAfterTestFinished
member.summary: This message is sent during execution to indicate that the After method of a has completed executing.

member.name: T:Xunit.Abstractions.ITestMessage
member.summary: This is the base interface for all test messages. A test message is a message that is used to communicate the status of discovery and execution of tests.

member.name: P:Xunit.Abstractions.IAfterTestFinished.AttributeName
member.summary: The fully qualified type name of the .

member.name: P:Xunit.Abstractions.IAfterTestFinished.TestCase
member.summary: The test case that this message applies to.

member.name: P:Xunit.Abstractions.IAfterTestFinished.TestDisplayName
member.summary: The display name to be used for this test.

member.name: T:Xunit.Abstractions.IAfterTestStarting
member.summary: This message is sent during execution to indicate that the After method of a is about to execute.

member.name: P:Xunit.Abstractions.IAfterTestStarting.AttributeName
member.summary: The fully qualified type name of the .

member.name: P:Xunit.Abstractions.IAfterTestStarting.TestCase
member.summary: The test case that this message applies to.

member.name: P:Xunit.Abstractions.IAfterTestStarting.TestDisplayName
member.summary: The display name to be used for this test.

member.name: T:Xunit.Abstractions.IBeforeTestFinished
member.summary: This message is sent during execution to indicate that the Before method of a has completed executing.

member.name: P:Xunit.Abstractions.IBeforeTestFinished.AttributeName
member.summary: The fully qualified type name of the .

member.name: P:Xunit.Abstractions.IBeforeTestFinished.TestCase
member.summary: The test case that this message applies to.

member.name: P:Xunit.Abstractions.IBeforeTestFinished.TestDisplayName
member.summary: The display name to be used for this test.

member.name: T:Xunit.Abstractions.IBeforeTestStarting
member.summary: This message is sent during execution to indicate that the Before method of a is about to execute.

member.name: P:Xunit.Abstractions.IBeforeTestStarting.AttributeName
member.summary: The fully qualified type name of the .

member.name: P:Xunit.Abstractions.IBeforeTestStarting.TestCase
member.summary: The test case that this message applies to.

member.name: P:Xunit.Abstractions.IBeforeTestStarting.TestDisplayName
member.summary: The display name to be used for this test.

member.name: T:Xunit.Abstractions.IErrorMessage
member.summary: This message indicates that an error has occurred in the execution process.

member.name: P:Xunit.Abstractions.IErrorMessage.ExceptionType
member.summary: The fully-qualified type name of the exception.

member.name: P:Xunit.Abstractions.IErrorMessage.Message
member.summary: The message of the exception.

member.name: P:Xunit.Abstractions.IErrorMessage.StackTrace
member.summary: The stack trace of the exception.

member.name: T:Xunit.Abstractions.IFinishedMessage
member.summary: This is the base message for various types of completion that can occur during the various phases of execution process (e.g., test case, test class, test collection, and assembly).

member.name: P:Xunit.Abstractions.IFinishedMessage.ExecutionTime
member.summary: The execution time (in seconds) for this execution.

member.name: P:Xunit.Abstractions.IFinishedMessage.TestsFailed
member.summary: The number of failing tests.

member.name: P:Xunit.Abstractions.IFinishedMessage.TestsRun
member.summary: The total number of tests run.

member.name: P:Xunit.Abstractions.IFinishedMessage.TestsSkipped
member.summary: The number of skipped tests.

member.name: T:Xunit.Abstractions.ITestAssemblyFinished
member.summary: This message indicates that the execution process has been completed for the requested assembly.

member.name: T:Xunit.Abstractions.ITestAssemblyStarting
member.summary: This message indicates that the execution process is about to start for the requested assembly.

member.name: T:Xunit.Abstractions.ITestCaseFinished
member.summary: This message indicates that a test case has finished executing.

member.name: P:Xunit.Abstractions.ITestCaseFinished.TestCase
member.summary: The test case that has finished executing.

member.name: T:Xunit.Abstractions.ITestCaseStarting
member.summary: This message indicates that a test case is about to start executing.

member.name: P:Xunit.Abstractions.ITestCaseStarting.TestCase
member.summary: The test case that is about to execute.

member.name: T:Xunit.Abstractions.ITestClassConstructionFinished
member.summary: This message indicates that an instance of a test class has just been constructed. Instance (non-static) methods of tests get a new instance of the test class for each individual test execution; static methods do not get an instance of the test class.

member.name: P:Xunit.Abstractions.ITestClassConstructionFinished.TestCase
member.summary: The test case that this class was constructed for.

member.name: P:Xunit.Abstractions.ITestClassConstructionFinished.TestDisplayName
member.summary: The display name of the test case.

member.name: T:Xunit.Abstractions.ITestClassConstructionStarting
member.summary: This message indicates that an instance of a test class is about to be constructed. Instance (non-static) methods of tests get a new instance of the test class for each individual test execution; static methods do not get an instance of the test class.

member.name: P:Xunit.Abstractions.ITestClassConstructionStarting.TestCase
member.summary: The test case that this class is being constructed for.

member.name: P:Xunit.Abstractions.ITestClassConstructionStarting.TestDisplayName
member.summary: The display name of the test case.

member.name: T:Xunit.Abstractions.ITestClassDisposeFinished
member.summary: This message indicates that the method was just called on the test class for the test case that just finished executing.

member.name: P:Xunit.Abstractions.ITestClassDisposeFinished.TestCase
member.summary: The test case that just finished executing.

member.name: P:Xunit.Abstractions.ITestClassDisposeFinished.TestDisplayName
member.summary: The display name of the test case.

member.name: T:Xunit.Abstractions.ITestClassDisposeStarting
member.summary: This message indicates that the method is about to be called on the test class for the test case that just finished executing.

member.name: P:Xunit.Abstractions.ITestClassDisposeStarting.TestCase
member.summary: The test case that just finished executing.

member.name: P:Xunit.Abstractions.ITestClassDisposeStarting.TestDisplayName
member.summary: The display name of the test case.

member.name: T:Xunit.Abstractions.ITestClassFinished
member.summary: This message indicates that a test class has finished executing (meaning, all of the test cases in this test class have finished running).

member.name: P:Xunit.Abstractions.ITestClassFinished.ClassName
member.summary: The fully-qualified name of the test class.

member.name: T:Xunit.Abstractions.ITestClassStarting
member.summary: This message indicates that a test class is about to begin running.

member.name: P:Xunit.Abstractions.ITestClassStarting.ClassName
member.summary: The fully-qualified name of the test class.

member.name: T:Xunit.Abstractions.ITestCollectionFinished
member.summary: This message indicates that a test collection has just finished executing (meaning, all the test classes in the collection has finished).

member.name: T:Xunit.Abstractions.ITestCollectionStarting
member.summary: This message indicates that a test collection has is about to start executing.

member.name: T:Xunit.Abstractions.ITestFailed
member.summary: This message indicates that a test has failed.

member.name: T:Xunit.Abstractions.ITestResultMessage
member.summary: This is the base interface for all individual test results (e.g., tests which pass, fail, or are skipped).

member.name: P:Xunit.Abstractions.ITestResultMessage.ExecutionTime
member.summary: The execution time of the test, in seconds.

member.name: P:Xunit.Abstractions.ITestResultMessage.TestCase
member.summary: The test case that this test is associated with.

member.name: P:Xunit.Abstractions.ITestResultMessage.TestDisplayName
member.summary: The display name of the test.

member.name: P:Xunit.Abstractions.ITestFailed.ExceptionType
member.summary: The fully-qualified type name of the exception.

member.name: P:Xunit.Abstractions.ITestFailed.Message
member.summary: The message of the exception.

member.name: P:Xunit.Abstractions.ITestFailed.StackTrace
member.summary: The stack trace of the exception.

member.name: T:Xunit.Abstractions.ITestFinished
member.summary: This message indicates that a test has finished executing.

member.name: P:Xunit.Abstractions.ITestFinished.TestCase
member.summary: The test case that this test belongs to.

member.name: P:Xunit.Abstractions.ITestFinished.TestDisplayName
member.summary: The display name of the test.

member.name: T:Xunit.Abstractions.ITestMethodFinished
member.summary: This message indicates that a test method has finished executing (meaning, all the test cases that derived from the test method have finished).

member.name: P:Xunit.Abstractions.ITestMethodFinished.ClassName
member.summary: The fully-qualified name of the test class.

member.name: P:Xunit.Abstractions.ITestMethodFinished.MethodName
member.summary: The name of the test method.

member.name: T:Xunit.Abstractions.ITestMethodStarting
member.summary: This message indicates that a test method is about to begin executing.

member.name: P:Xunit.Abstractions.ITestMethodStarting.ClassName
member.summary: The fully-qualified name of the test class.

member.name: P:Xunit.Abstractions.ITestMethodStarting.MethodName
member.summary: The name of the test method.

member.name: T:Xunit.Abstractions.ITestPassed
member.summary: Indicates that a test has passed.

member.name: T:Xunit.Abstractions.ITestSkipped
member.summary: This message indicates that a test was skipped.

member.name: P:Xunit.Abstractions.ITestSkipped.Reason
member.summary: The reason given for skipping the test.

member.name: T:Xunit.Abstractions.ITestStarting
member.summary: This message indicates that a test is about to start executing.

member.name: P:Xunit.Abstractions.ITestStarting.TestCase
member.summary: The test case that this test belongs to.

member.name: P:Xunit.Abstractions.ITestStarting.TestDisplayName
member.summary: The display name of the test.

member.name: T:Xunit.Abstractions.IParameterInfo
member.summary: Represents information about a method parameter. The primary implementation is based on runtime reflection, but may also be implemented by runner authors to provide non-reflection-based test discovery (for example, AST-based runners like CodeRush or Resharper).

member.name: P:Xunit.Abstractions.IParameterInfo.Name
member.summary: The name of the parameter.

member.name: T:Xunit.Abstractions.IReflectionParameterInfo
member.summary: Represents a reflection-backed implementation of .

member.name: P:Xunit.Abstractions.IReflectionParameterInfo.ParameterInfo
member.summary: Gets the underlying for the parameter.

member.name: T:Xunit.Abstractions.IDiscoveryCompleteMessage
member.summary: This message indicates that the discovery process has been completed for the requested assembly.

member.name: T:Xunit.Abstractions.IMessageSink
member.summary: Represents an endpoint for the reception of test messages.

member.name: M:Xunit.Abstractions.IMessageSink.OnMessage(Xunit.Abstractions.ITestMessage)
member.summary: Reports the presence of a message on the message bus. This method should never throw exceptions.
member.param: The message from the message bus

member.name: T:Xunit.Abstractions.ITestCaseDiscoveryMessage
member.summary: This message indicates that a test case had been found during the discovery process.

member.name: P:Xunit.Abstractions.ITestCaseDiscoveryMessage.TestCase
member.summary: The test case that was discovered.

member.name: T:Xunit.Abstractions.IAssemblyInfo
member.summary: Represents information about an assembly. The primary implementation is based on runtime reflection, but may also be implemented by runner authors to provide non-reflection-based test discovery (for example, AST-based runners like CodeRush or Resharper).

member.name: M:Xunit.Abstractions.IAssemblyInfo.GetCustomAttributes(System.String)
member.summary: Gets all the custom attributes for the given assembly.
member.param: The type of the attribute, in assembly-qualified form
member.returns: The matching attributes that decorate the assembly

member.name: M:Xunit.Abstractions.IAssemblyInfo.GetType(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a for the given type.
member.param: The fully qualified type name.
member.returns: The if the type exists, or null if not.

member.name: M:Xunit.Abstractions.IAssemblyInfo.GetTypes(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets all the types for the assembly.
member.param: Set to true to return all types in the assembly, or false to return only public types.

member.name: P:Xunit.Abstractions.IAssemblyInfo.AssemblyPath
member.summary: Gets the on-disk location of the assembly under test. If the assembly path is not known (for example, in AST-based runners), you must return null.
member.remarks: This is used by the test framework wrappers to find the co-located unit test framework assembly (f.e., xunit.dll or xunit2.dll). AST-based runners will need to directly create instances of and (using the constructors that support an explicit path to the test framework DLL) rather than relying on the use of .

member.name: P:Xunit.Abstractions.IAssemblyInfo.Name
member.summary: Gets the assembly name. May return a fully qualified name for assemblies found via reflection (i.e., "mscorlib, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b77a5c561934e089"), or may return just assembly name only for assemblies found via source code introspection (i.e., "mscorlib").

member.name: T:Xunit.Abstractions.IAttributeInfo
member.summary: Represents information about an attribute. The primary implementation is based on runtime reflection, but may also be implemented by runner authors to provide non-reflection-based test discovery (for example, AST-based runners like CodeRush or Resharper).

member.name: M:Xunit.Abstractions.IAttributeInfo.GetConstructorArguments
member.summary: Gets the arguments passed to the constructor.

member.name: M:Xunit.Abstractions.IAttributeInfo.GetCustomAttributes(System.String)
member.summary: Gets all the custom attributes for the given attribute.
member.param: The type of the attribute to find, in assembly-qualified form
member.returns: The matching attributes that decorate the attribute

member.name: M:Xunit.Abstractions.IAttributeInfo.GetNamedArgument``1(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a named-argument initialized value of the attribute.
member.param: The name of the argument

member.name: T:Xunit.Abstractions.IMethodInfo
member.summary: Represents information about a method. The primary implementation is based on runtime reflection, but may also be implemented by runner authors to provide non-reflection-based test discovery (for example, AST-based runners like CodeRush or Resharper).

member.name: M:Xunit.Abstractions.IMethodInfo.GetCustomAttributes(System.String)
member.summary: Gets all the custom attributes for the method that are of the given type.
member.param: The type of the attribute, in assembly qualified form
member.returns: The matching attributes that decorate the method

member.name: M:Xunit.Abstractions.IMethodInfo.GetParameters
member.summary: Gets information about the parameters to the method.

member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the method is abstract.

member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the method is public.

member.name: P:Xunit.Abstractions.IMethodInfo.IsStatic
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the method is static.

member.name: P:Xunit.Abstractions.IMethodInfo.Name
member.summary: Gets the name of the method.

member.name: P:Xunit.Abstractions.IMethodInfo.ReturnType
member.summary: Gets the fully qualified type name of the return type.

member.name: P:Xunit.Abstractions.IMethodInfo.Type
member.summary: Gets a value which represents the class that this method was reflected from (i.e., equivalent to MethodInfo.ReflectedType)

member.summary: Represents a reflection-backed implementation of .

member.name: P:Xunit.Abstractions.IReflectionMethodInfo.MethodInfo
member.summary: Gets the underlying for the method.

member.name: T:Xunit.Abstractions.IReflectionTypeInfo
member.summary: Represents a reflection-backed implementation of .

member.name: T:Xunit.Abstractions.ITypeInfo
member.summary: Represents information about a type. The primary implementation is based on runtime reflection, but may also be implemented by runner authors to provide non-reflection-based test discovery (for example, AST-based runners like CodeRush or Resharper).

member.name: M:Xunit.Abstractions.ITypeInfo.GetCustomAttributes(System.String)
member.summary: Gets all the custom attributes for the given type.
member.param: The type of the attribute, in assembly qualified form
member.returns: The matching attributes that decorate the type

member.name: M:Xunit.Abstractions.ITypeInfo.GetMethods(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets all the methods in this type.
member.param: Set to true to return all methods in the type, or false to return only public methods.

member.name: P:Xunit.Abstractions.ITypeInfo.Assembly
member.summary: Gets the assembly this type is located in.

member.name: P:Xunit.Abstractions.ITypeInfo.BaseType
member.summary: Gets the base type of the given type.

member.name: P:Xunit.Abstractions.ITypeInfo.Interfaces
member.summary: Gets the interfaces implemented by the given type.

member.name: P:Xunit.Abstractions.ITypeInfo.IsAbstract
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the type is abstract.

member.name: P:Xunit.Abstractions.ITypeInfo.IsSealed
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the type is sealed.

member.name: P:Xunit.Abstractions.ITypeInfo.Name
member.summary: Gets the fully qualified type name.

member.name: P:Xunit.Abstractions.IReflectionTypeInfo.Type
member.summary: Gets the underlying object.

member.name: T:Xunit.Abstractions.ITestCase
member.summary: Represents a single test case in the system. This test case usually represents a single test, but in the case of dynamically generated data for data driven tests, the test case may actually return multiple results when run.

member.name: P:Xunit.Abstractions.ITestCase.Class
member.summary: Gets the class that this test case is attached to.

member.name: P:Xunit.Abstractions.ITestCase.DisplayName
member.summary: Gets the display name of the test case.

member.name: P:Xunit.Abstractions.ITestCase.Method
member.summary: Gets the method associated with this test case.

member.name: P:Xunit.Abstractions.ITestCase.SkipReason
member.summary: Gets the display text for the reason a test is being skipped; if the test is not skipped, returns null.

member.name: P:Xunit.Abstractions.ITestCase.SourceFileLine
member.summary: Get the source file line where the test is defined, if requested (and known).

member.name: P:Xunit.Abstractions.ITestCase.SourceFileName
member.summary: Gets the source file name where the test is defined, if requested (and known).

member.name: P:Xunit.Abstractions.ITestCase.TestCollection
member.summary: Gets the test collection this test case belongs to.

member.name: P:Xunit.Abstractions.ITestCase.Traits
member.summary: Gets the trait values associated with this test case. If there are none, or the framework does not support traits, this should return an empty dictionary (not null). This dictionary must be treated as read-only.

member.name: P:Xunit.Abstractions.ITestCase.UniqueID
member.summary: Gets a unique identifier for the test case.
member.remarks: The unique identifier for a test case should be able to discriminate among test cases, even those which are varied invocations against the same test method (i.e., theories). Ideally, this identifier would remain stable until such time as the developer changes some fundamental part of the identity (assembly, class name, test name, or test data); however, the minimum stability of the identifier must at least extend across multiple discoveries of the same test in the same (non-recompiled) assembly.

member.name: T:Xunit.Abstractions.ITestCollection
member.summary: Represents a group of test cases. Test collections form the basis of the parallelization in xUnit.net. Test cases which are in the same test collection will not be run in parallel against sibling tests, but will run in parallel against tests in other collections.

member.name: P:Xunit.Abstractions.ITestCollection.DisplayName
member.summary: The display name of the test collection.
